frameDefinitions: An Agent has done or omitted to do an Act or is responsible for the obtaining of a State_of_affairs, which a Judge deems to constitute a violation of an obligation or a moral guideline.
The Support, a phenomenon or fact,  lends support to a claim or proposed course of action, the Proposition, where the Domain_of_relevance may also be expressed.
A volitional  Agent is responding to a State_of_affairs by performing some Action.
A Judge refrains from imposing, or demanding a punishment for an Evaluee who has committed an Offense.
An Agent wants to achieve a Goal,  or an object.
An Arguer presents a Content, along with Support, to an Addressee.
frameExamples: Kim failed to fully <t>justify</t> his decision.
The latest poll results <t>show</t> that support of the president is at an all-time low.
And was that your <t>reason</t> for becoming an actor ?
The modest American <t>goal</t> of a threefold increase in capacity recognises this fact .
Jan <t>argued</t> that the evidence was inadmissable.
listRoleDefinitions: The person or organization that  is held responsible for a prior <fen>Act</fen> or for a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
An action  for which the <fen>Agent</fen> is held responsible, frequently one that the <fen>Agent</fen> has taken themself.
A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> that the Agent is held responsible for.
The <fen>Time</fen> of the justifying event.
Support is a fact that lends epistemic support to a claim, or that provides a reason for a course of action. Typically it is expressed as an External Argument.
This is a belief, claim, or proposed course of action to which the Support lends validity. Normally it is expressed as a Finite Clause Complement:
The person who responds to a <fen>State_of_Affairs</fen> by performing some <fen>Action</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs in response to a <fen>State_of_Affairs</fen>.
The eventuality  that motivates the <fen>Agent</fen>'s performing a particular <fen>Action</fen> in response to it.
The <fen>Judge</fen> holds the <fen>Evaluee</fen> responsible for the <fen>Offense</fen>.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is subject to the judgment of the <fen>Judge</fen> for having committed the <fen>Offense</fen>.
The <fen>Offense</fen> is the illicit or unpleasant act committed by the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.
The volitional actor who intends to achieve a goal.
The action or state of affairs that the Agent wants to achieve.
A <fen>Means</fen> is an object or action that is used or designed to achieve a particular <fen>Goal</fen>.
This role marks expressions that indicate an <fen>Attribute</fen> for which it is the <fen>Agent</fen>'s goal that it have or reach a particular <fen>Value</fen> .
This role marks expressions that indicate which <fen>Value</fen> the <fen>Agent</fen> wants the <fen>Attribute</fen> to reach.
This Frame Element expresses a time period during which an <fen>Agent</fen> had a particular <fen>Goal</fen>.

The <fen>Arguer</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to entertain the <fen>Content</fen>, which can be a proposition to be believed or a course of action to be taken, based on the <fen>Support</fen> presented.
The <fen>Arguer</fen> presents the <fen>Content</fen> before the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The Time at which an <fen>Arguer</fen> makes an argument for the <fen>Content</fen>.
This role identifies the location where an argument is made by an <fen>Arguer</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Smithers</fex> defended his decision by insisting that he had used his best judgment
Kim failed  to fully justify <fex>his decision</fex>.
The lawyers tried  to justify <fex>enormous punitive damages being paid to victims on a first-past-the-post system</fex> .
<fex>The fact that you lied to me</fex> shows that I shouldn't trust you.
The fact that you lied to me shows <fex>that I shouldn't trust you</fex>.
Those are <fex>my</fex> reasons , ' said Toby .
I find that all my reasons <fex>for postponing giving birth</fex> still apply
My reason is <fex>that our cities are now designed round the motor car</fex>
God forgives <fex>repentant sinners</fex>.
Won't you forgive me <fex>for keeping it a secret</fex>?
<fex>Microsoft 's</fex> goal of delivering a million copies in the first year is trifling compared to the 25 million copies of Windows it has shipped since May 1990.
The company missed its goal <fex>of getting a thousand third-party software packages shipped</fex>.
The goal <fex>of treatment</fex> was to lower diastolic blood pressure below 85 mm  Hg .
We exceeded our <fex>production</fex> target of 2000 units
GM has a production target <fex>of 2,000,000 units</fex>
But the main goal <fex>of the 1990s</fex> could be to transform a big , heavily armed standing army into a more flexible force
Jan argued <fex>that the evidence was inadmissable</fex>.
<fex>Jan</fex> argued that the evidence was inadmissable.
The government argued <fex>in August</fex> that the prisoners should not be released
The young men will be arguing their policies <fex>in the school auditorium</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Colloquy, Tights and Tiaras: Female Superheroes and Media Cultures
